subject: Communication
title: Internal vs. External Self-Awareness
description: A fast breakdown of Internal vs. External Self-Awareness for builders.

hook.text: He knew exactly what he felt and why. But he had no idea how others experienced him. Half-aware is half-blind.

buildup.text: Tasha Eurich's research distinguishes two types: internal self-awareness (understanding your own emotions) and.

discovery.text: They're independent. You can be high on one and low on the other. True self-awareness requires both.

twist.text: Introspection alone doesn't improve self-awareness. In fact, excessive 'why' questioning can create false narratives.

climax.text: Eurich found that 'what' questions ('What am I feeling?') beat 'why' questions â€” 'why' traps us in ruminative loops.

punchline.text: Don't just look inward. Learn how you land outward.

quiz.question: Which type of question improves self-awareness more, according to Eurich?
